bug.short_desc: qx.test.ui.embed.Flash.testEvents fails in IE 11 on Win 8.1

long_desc.thetext: Error message is: expected loaded to have been called at least once but was never called: Called fail().

Our flash widget (i.e. "qx.ui.embed.Flash") generally doesn't work with IE 11.
See: http://demo.qooxdoo.org/3.5/demobrowser/
In Detail: The environment selection for "engine.name => mshtml" within "qx.bom.Flash" has to be adapted because with IE 11 this code doesn't work anymore. However the code executed with the setting "engine.name => default" works now in IE 11.
This might be a good chance to remove the widget in general. I'm not sure if thats a good idea and the community needs the flash widget so we should check that before thinking about a removal.

(In reply to comment #4) > IMHO, abandoning the widget might not be the best solution: > 1. Flash is almost dead in the mobile platforms but is still well alive in > desktop platforms, for which qooxdoo support has been great; > 2. Personally, I don't use that widget (as we use SVG instead) but I believe > many will still find it useful; > 3. We've developed a similar widget for embedding SVG (not in the same scope of > the contrib, which is to provide a canvas-like) and, although in production, it > was never contributed as it needs further polishing to match qooxdoo standards; > 4. I've already hinted in the past towards providing even further media > embedding support (such as audio), although there wasn't much reception. > > Disclaimer: I haven't been following other interaction channels, such as the > mailing list.
Thanks for the feedback. Good to hear the opinion of devs using the framework!
Fixed by applying the 'default' code paths in IE 11 as suggested by Richard. bd12cbb5dbfe15b06ab92b81655e294fe44cc6e5 (master) 26f75aa1237923a7292d25abe17ca8625a96afca (branch_4_0_x)
